title: Saving SDK data for embedding statistics
body: resolves step 1, 2, 3, and 3.1 of #45952 Introduces a middleware to set 2 dynamic vars which will be set from headers by the SDK, adds columns to `query_execution` and `view_log` tables, and wraps the toucan before-insert methods for `QueryExecution` and `ViewLog` to add the dynamic var values to their respective entities. ### Why a middleware? The embedding SDK uses a variety of metabase http endpoints, so to capture the SDK client and version info, it's best to read them in a middleware. ### Why not use the `*request*` dynamic var? I didn't think it was good to have this be dependent on that middleware's existence. We have enough hidden dependencies already, so this intentionally follows the "locality of behavior" principle. ### Why are the headers lower-cased? That's the [ring spec](https://github.com/ring-clojure/ring/blob/master/SPEC.md#headers). In fact the ring mock request (which generates request map data) does that too.
author: escherize
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Fix editing models with metadata overrides
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45924

The fix consists of 2 parts:
- Using existing `card.result_metadata` in the model editor when computing the effective query results. So it's query results -> card result metadata -> metadata diff.
- Re-running the query when a model is updated. A model can be updated with either query or metadata change. I don't want to deal with making outdated query results correct by "fixing" them on the FE, so let's just re-run the query and make it simple and robust.

How to verify:
- Open some model
- Edit metadata -> Rename a column
- Query tab -> Change the query and re-run it
- Go back to Metadata tab -> The column name should not be lost
- Save changes -> The column name should not be lost
author: ranquild
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: fix(perf): Allow weekdays to be translated differently in weekly v monthly schedules
body:
In several languages the word 'Sunday' is translated differently in 'Send weekly on Sunday' vs. 'Send monthly on the first Sunday'. So we need separate translations of weekdays mentioned in a monthly schedule and weekdays mentioned in a weekly schedule. To my knowledge, these languages include Russian, Polish, Czech, Finnish, and Hungarian.

This PR also provides a bit more context to guide translators. The translations of 'Monday', 'Tuesday', etc., into most languages should not be capitalized.
author: rafpaf
labels: [('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: fix(admin/performance): Fix default time bug in Schedule policy
body:
Closes #45916

### Description

On master there is the following bug: if you switch to a weekly or monthly schedule strategy, but leave the time at the default value of 8am, the schedule that will get saved in the BE will use the _wildcard_ for the hour (rather than the integer 8), resulting in many more cache invalidations than you wanted.

Here's an illustration of the bug and the fix: https://www.loom.com/share/7065bd50b8a14f9ea4071af7fe327631?sid=e82d2ab7-993b-4f41-99c1-4bc4ef1e434f

### How to verify

Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.

1. Admin / Performance
2. Take a database that does not use the schedule strategy and change it to the schedule strategy. Choose weekly. Don't change the time.
3. On master, you'll see in DevTools / Network that there is no integer 8 in the cron expression sent to the BE. On this branch, you'll see an 8.

### Checklist

[x] Tests added here (this required bringing in some helpers from a downstream branch)
author: rafpaf
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: fix(webapp/browse): Use user locale if available in Browse models
body:
Previously the Browse models feature looked up the locale (so that sorting is locale-dependent) - but it only looked up the _instance-wide_ locale (aka the "site locale"). This PR adds a general hook for looking up the currently used locale. It first checks the user's locale, and if this is not set, it uses the instance-wide locale.

This PR also tests that the `sortModels` utility function respects the locale provided.
author: rafpaf
labels: [('Customization/i18n', ''), ('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: dx: clean output folder before building jar
body:
### Description

We use `writeToDisk` option, so all our "hot" files are saved into `resources/frontend_client/app/dist`, seems all the `.js`, '.js.map` and other static files were copied into jar file during building jar locally, so the size of jar could become 1.3Gb instead of 370Mb

[thread](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C010L1Z4F9S/p1721649291730969)

### How to verify

- CI is green
- `rm -rf ./target && ./bin/build.sh`, the resulted jar file will be under 400Mb

labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DevEx', '')]

title: we had unlimited xrays since 2018 and it is time to end this madness
body:
Fixes #43258

Back in 2018, we've [set `:show` to be `:all`](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/commit/77500ca6e9fa7df55e3a439fa5fc05411665cba3) for x-ray dashboard, and so our card limit was not respected. We've agreed to limit this to 30 cards per x-ray dashboard.

I'm having hard time to understand what to test, since this seems more like a configuration (and this option is supplied all over the tests, so it's tested well), rather than a behavior change.

title: Usage API
body:
Playing around with a consolidated API for tracking usage of dashboards
and cards.

The idea here is that we offer a performant API for tracking card or
dashboard usage. `(usage/track! :model/Card card-id)` is all you need.

The module has the following public functions:

- `(column model)`: the column name for the last used at field. This is
what you want to use when you're trying to get the date of last usage
in a t2/select.

- `(track! model id)`: mentioned above, a performant API for tracking
usage of a card or dashboard. Internally, it adds to an in-memory queue
of jobs, deduplicating based on the model/id (selecting the latest usage
time available)

- `(init!)` and `(stop!)` for starting and stopping processing. By
default, processing happens in separate threads.

Playing around with performance, a single call to `track!` takes about
.005ms on my machine, so we could add 200,000 calls to `track!` in a
single HTTP request and only add one second to the response time.

That example queue of 200,000 jobs would take ~1-2 seconds to fully
process. (On my machine! With a local DB! But still - seems like a lot of 
headroom available.)

`init!` starts a worker thread that will check the queue every second.
If it finds data in the queue, it will attempt to drain it in 1000-item
chunks.

`stop!` stops the workers and then drains the queue.
author: johnswanson
labels: [('Stale', 'Stale PRs that will be auto-closed'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: ci: re-enable node cache to speedup initial yarn install
body:
### Description We have 3 different cases of using cache of node_modules at CI: 1. `node_modules` were already cached, so we can just restore it, yarn verifies if all packages are installed -> **fastest**
~2s for `yarn install`

2. `yarn.lock` is updated -> there is no cache for `node_modules` - yarn fetches all packages from registry, saves them to global cache and copies them to node_modules -> **slowest**
~90s for `yarn install` after latest cleanup

3. `yarn.lock` is updated -> there is no cache for `node_modules`, **but** there is cache for most of the packages in global yarn cache, which we can restore from previous builds. In this case yarn fetches only packages which are not presented in global yarn cache and copies them to `node_modules` - **fast enough** There is overhead to save and restore global yarn cache in this case, but we do it conditionally and only when `node_modules` cache is missing. `Post prepare frontend` adds ~15-20s to save yarn cache as it's big, but it's a win anyway
~45s for `yarn install`

With current change, if we miss `node_modules`, we do not go with case 2, but we go with case 3, shaving half of the time required for installing node_modules in the worst case
author: uladzimirdev
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/DevEx', '')]

title: fix(admin/nav): Ensure that the "Exit admin" button can be clicked regardless of locale or viewport size
body:
Ellipsifies nav items when there's not enough horizontal space to display them.

This ensures that the Exit button is always clickable regardless of locale or viewport size.

Some locales, like Russian, French, and German, previously required so much horizontal space to display the admin nav links that the Exit button was pushed partly or wholly offscreen for viewports around 1000px.

This branch uses a _pure CSS_ approach, so it may be a good balance between attractive design and simplicity of implementation.

![Kapture 2024-07-25 at 10 39 40](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/89053f0f-d983-47d5-ad91-63a276e847ca)

These ellipsified items have no tooltips. Tooltips require measuring the text with js on the fly, and we didn't think the performance overhead was worth it. You can always see the full name of the tab when you click on it.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f814a35b-c645-4c50-b26b-7d480cb20d8d)

**Screencast**: In this [loom](https://www.loom.com/share/cefc64d7fa314739826664aaf5804e90) I show what this looks like in a variety of locales.


Closes #45876

title: Fix #45877: Duplicated boolean options in a filter dropdown menu
body:
Closes #45877

### Description
[This line](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/43293/files#diff-42c21bc38d698c32274a41b96dd510d6a86589a30dad488d037089084e4d7025R30) didn't take into account boolean filter values. So we'd add an additional `true|false` to the existing options [here](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/4e7ae5cb1ed9a842fbb140ac52cfef8974ceb994/frontend/src/metabase/components/ListField/ListField.tsx#L47)

The fix was to simply remove the condition `type of value !== "string"`, but that resulted in a type error (which is why it was most likely added in the first place):

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ee9e17d3-78ff-4ec7-8238-563839ae81bf)

The solution to this was to [use an actual JavaScript `Map`](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/45880/files#diff-42c21bc38d698c32274a41b96dd510d6a86589a30dad488d037089084e4d7025R28). Kudos to @ranquild for the idea.

### How to verify
Follow the repro steps or simply run E2E reproduction.

### Demo
Before
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/436d3520-14e8-4994-8f86-edc3dc801fc6)

Now
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55296267-cfff-4c2f-b58f-cbfb334faa94)


### Checklist
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Redshift CI flake fix: enable robust sync behavior in tests
body:
In normal prod usage sync failures get caught and logged and sync carries on, for example if sync fails for one Table we catch it but continue syncing the other tables.

Normally when loading test data we disable this catch-and-continue behavior so we can find bugs or problems with the sync code or test data loading code more easily. Redshift sync tends to get flaky however in tests because we're creating and deleting a lot of tables and sometimes tables deleted a few seconds ago get reported as still being present when we try to sync that DB again, but then sync on the table itself fails because it's gone. 

Prior to #45268 we disabled deleting tables during test runs for Redshift due to flakiness, but I reenabled deletion because it was causing problems in lots of tests since we no longer destroyed and reloaded the test data so many times...

This is my new fix for the issue, enable robust sync behavior for Redshift. I want to see if this fixes the problem or not and unblocks CI. I will try to come up with a more robust long-term solution as a follow on at some point -- I want to get to the bottom of why Redshift is reporting deleted tables as still being present (is this info getting cached somewhere?)
author: camsaul
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: Support out of order expression references
body: Fixes #44584 In fact, this fixes the second problem in #44584, which is caused by Clojure maps of size 10 or more losing the ordering. Losing the ordering is an old problem, also present in version 49, and this PR doesn't fix it, as it seems a bigger task. What's the new problem then, that we do want to fix? Imagine that the tenth expression is added to the list and it refers to the expressions defined before it. When this expression is added, it will show up at a "random" position depending on how Clojure hashes the keys. And here comes the new problem: in version 50, we changed how expressions are handled. When editing an expression (aka custom column), we don't provide information about the succeeding expressions to the FE. This is useful, because it prevents creating cyclic references. But it means that if you try to edit the tenth expression and it has been placed before a referred expression, the editor won't be able to resolve the reference and it renders an empty string instead of the name of the referred expression. This is the reported bug. With this change, any expression will "see" all the other expressions. That means, that it's again possible to introduce cyclic dependencies. Luckily, we have implemented some checks, and one of them is detecting cyclic dependencies. The user will see something like this: This is an improvement on v49 which would accept cyclic references. I realize an e2e test would make a lot of sense and I might write one in a follow up PR. I have made an experimental attempt to preserve the ordering, but I stumbled on several obstacles and I think we would need to change the legacy/JS/wire format to properly implement that. I think this quick fix makes sense now.
author: metamben

title: Lock down the trash collection more
body:
Oops. I was very thorough in checking that you couldn't modify the trash collection in the sense of moving things to or from it. I missed the most obvious thing: actually modifying the trash collection itself. So if someone wanted, they could change the name of the Trash to "Definitely Not the Trash".

Fixes #44817

title: [MBQL lib] Cache round trips between legacy and lib in both directions
body:
### Description


Previously, conversions from legacy to MLv2 were cached based on the identity of the incoming query.

This PR adds new caching for round trips in both directions:
1. When converting to MLv2, the legacy form is saved in the Clojure metadata. When converting back that value is used
   unless the query has been edited.
2. When converting to legacy, the MLv2 form is saved in a non-enumerable JS property. When converting back to MLv2,
   that value is used unless the `metadata-provider` has changed.

See the comments in `metabase.lib.js/query`  and `legacy-query` for more details.

**NOTE** All of this refers only to the CLJS side.

### How to verify

This should be invisible, except for the speedup. Put a breakpoint in the inner conversion functions like
`legacy-query*` to check if they're called on a round trip.

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: bshepherdson
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: ci: run fe builds in parallel during jar buildling
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45907 ### Description we can run static-viz and main build in parallel at ci, main build takes way longer. a new dependency `npm-run-all` added to avoid having `yarn ...` in scripts and be able to run them in parallel. it's similar to `concurrently` that we already have, but less verbose imo examples of the successful build https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/10043158684/job/27755278734?pr=45864 ### How to verify CI is green

title: fix(sdk): missing semantic text colors mapping
body:
### Description

Shoppy has the wrong foreground text color right now, because `--mb-color-text-primary` did not get mapped to `var(--mb-color-text-dark)` in the sdk's code path, which means the theme options did not take effect. This PR adds the same mapping as we have in `colors.module.css` and `EmbedFrame.module.css`

![CleanShot 2567-07-19 at 22 23 29@2x](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6d427a6c-5f8e-42e0-989d-8a3f13a33187)

### How to verify

- Run Shoppy
- Foreground color should be #E3E7E4 for theStitch theme.
author: heypoom

[{'comment_id': 2239229395, 'issue_id': 2418973799, 'author': 'github-actions[bot]', 'body': '@github-automation-metabase You have modified embedding SDK code. Please make sure the PR title follows [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/) style.

Here are all the supported types that will be shown in the changelog:
- `feat`
- `fix`
- `perf`

These types `docs`, `style`, `refactor`, `test`, `build`, and `ci` are also encouraged for non-changelog related tasks.

Please also make sure to include `sdk` scope, otherwise, the changelog will not include this task.

title: Improve N+1 detection for simple hydration methods
body:
We have N+1 detection for simple hydration methods that checks to see whether the hydration method made any DB queries at all. This makes sense, because a simple hydration method is called on each instance individually - if we make database calls *each time*, we're in trouble.

Where this runs into issues is with cached data, where the simple hydration method is populating the cache - e.g. `:can_read` or `:can_write` dereferencing `api/*current-user-permissions-set*`. Currently we specifically exclude those hydration methods from the check.

But after running into this again for a different simple hydration method, I think there's a more robust approach:

- first, run the hydration method without counting DB queries

- then, run it again and make sure we don't make any additional DB queries.

There is a potential downside here: if someone wrote a simple hydration method with side effects, they'd potentially be very confused (in development - this doesn't run in prod!) when those side effects happened twice for a single hydration. But I *think* that's fairly unlikely.
author: johnswanson
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Remove can_run_adhoc_query
body: We added `can_run_adhoc_query` as performance optimization, but it made things worse. We also had a bug where `can_run_adhoc_query` had a different value than `isEditable`. And it made things harder to reason about because there are 2 properties. I think it was a failed experiment, let's revert this change now.

title: replace babel-loader with swc-loader
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/28779 Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/37577 [esbuild PoC](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/45845/files) ### Description Replace babel-loader with swc-loader to speed up production (and sometimes development) webpack build. Notes: - babel is kept to transpile fonts file as swc emotion plugin doesn't handle our case correctly. I didn't find a root cause of wrong behaviour, but the safe past is to keep using babel + emotion plugin for one file and all other can be transpiled with swc - react fast-refresh now handled by swc - swc-loader can't read browserslist config from package.json, so we had to manually specify supported browsers in webpack ### How to verify - CI is green - `yarn dev` works as before - `yarn build-release` produces more or less similar size js and css files ### Demo #### Before #### After

title: Hide upload config when data warehouse is attached
body:
== Goal ==

Prevent admins of Metabase Cloud instances with Metabase Cloud Storage
from accidentally breaking their upload configuration, since in this
scenario that is automatically managed by Metabase Cloud to use the
attached data warehouse.

== How to test ==

On a subscription with Metabase Cloud Storage:
* The "Uploads" section in the left sidebar of `/admin/settings` does
  not show
* A "not found" page is shown at `/admin/settings/uploads` where one
  would otherwise expect the "Uploads Settings" page
* `PUT /api/setting` with an `uploads-settings` field in the body fails
  with `403 Forbidden` and the setting is not changed
* `PUT /api/setting/uploads-settings` fails with `403 Forbidden` and
  the setting is not changed
* `GET /api/setting` contains an element with `key: "uploads-settings"`
  and a value
* `GET /api/setting/uploads-settings` responds with the value
* `GET /api/session/properties` contains the `uploads-settings` field

Closes: https://github.com/metabase/harbormaster/issues/5121
author: devurandom
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: [notification] update API to enable http channels for alert
body:
Milestone 2.3 of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43822.

This PR updates so that `POST /api/alert` and `PUT /api/alert` accept HTTP channels as destination.

Also:
- add a test for `POST /api/pulse/test` so we can use this to send tests when setting up the HTTP channel for alerts.
- add a test for `GET /api/pulse/form_input` to check that HTTP channels are returned correctly


I didnt' create a new `POST /api/alert/test` for this because we'll soon rework these apis as part of the new architecture.

title: Fix Analytics DB Appearing in Permissions
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44856

### Description

Filters out analytics database(s) in permissions which uses legacy database fetching logic.

The easiest way to reproduce this is:
1. Navigate to any instance-analytics question
2. refresh the page
3. open admin/permissions settings, and you will see the audit db in the database list

Before | After
---|---
![Screen Shot 2024-07-22 at 4 19 28 PM](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/88f2be47-380a-495b-a2ae-d13704b8f2ac) | ![Screen Shot 2024-07-22 at 4 20 26 PM](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2ad23203-9809-4b0a-96cd-461aec7ac2aa)
![Screen Shot 2024-07-22 at 4 19 36 PM](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bd50a253-9cf0-4ebd-b2be-154ba91386ef) | ![Screen Shot 2024-07-22 at 4 20 21 PM](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1802f4da-29f8-49a8-a4ee-55768effeb0c)



This has a pretty different fix in v49, where MLv2 isn't implemented as much yet. https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/45957


### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: docs: extract requires a db with regex

title: Snowflake: put local private key file info into the secrets table
body:
Fixes: #45393 (ü§û)

This change _looks_ simple, but there was a lot of iteration to get to this solution.

There are a few places where we can change how we handle local RSA keys for snowflake: 

1. in the model/Database before-insert hook, 
2. in `driver.u/can-connect-with-details?`,
3. in `defmethod driver/can-connect? :snowflake`
4. in `driver.snowflake/resolve-private-key`

And while I spent time trying to fix this closer to where we actually manage keys, I found that juggling the secrets and files in the driver code was a lot more complicated than just treating the local-file path as if it were uploaded, and uploaded keys work on clustered machines. (Though I still want to test this)

I also have a hunch that this problem afflicts multiple drivers, so I wrote it in a way that will be easy to expand to their needs.
author: escherize
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Fix editing model metadata - existing models, field visibility
body: Related https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/33844 Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45924 #### 33844 Previously, if you set "Detail views only" setting on a field in Model metadata, the editor would somewhat break. There are many symptoms of this problem. Now the setting is only saved but has no effect on data displayed in the table itself - the fields would be always visible. How to verify: - New -> Model -> Orders - Metadata -> Select ID -> Detail views only -> Save - Make sure the ID column is hidden in Simple mode now - Make sure that the object detail view still works despite the PK being hidden - Open Metadata Editor again. ID column should be visible and the value should "Detail views only". Change it to the default value and save - Make sure that the column became visible again. #### 45924 User-visible column metadata was calculated like this: ``` latest query results + metadata diff ``` The problem is that when re-running the query in the model editor, we update the `latest query results` and all previous defined metadata gets lost. Now the formula for computing the metadata is: ``` latest query results + card result metadata + metadata diff ``` With this change we don't lose original metadata again. There is another change that we need to do to make it work without browser refresh. The problem is that we don't re-run the query after editing model metadata because there is no query change. The new approach also doesn't help here. To make it work we overwrite the query results in the state with the calculated query results when saving a card. This is noop for non-models, and for models, this makes sure the query results metadata is up-to-date. How to verify: - New -> Model -> Orders - Click the run botton - Go to Metadata tab and rename some of the columns - Save the model - Model ... menu -> Edit metadata - Go to Query tab, add a sort clause, and re-run the model query without leaving the tab - Go to Metadata tab -> Your column names should not be lost - Save the model -> You would be redirected to Simple mode - Your custom column names should not be lost
author: ranquild
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Update popover dark theme on part of ParameterFieldWidget
body:
Relate to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45723

### Description

Update dark theme on some parts of ParameterFieldWidget
- Text field
- Search
- Dropdown

### How to verify

1. Create a GUI question from Orders table.
2. Create a dashboard and add the question to it.
3. Create 3 filters
  1. Text -> Category, dropdown list
  2. Text -> Category, input box
  3. Location -> User.City
4. save and embed the dashboard. Click sharing > embed > static embed
5. select Parameters tab, set all parameters to `Editable`
6. select Look and Feel tab, select `Dark` theme, and click preview.
7. Now you can play around with different filter popover in dark theme.

[Loki tests pass](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/10114656664/job/27973781441?pr=46067). 

### Demo
Take a look at loki snapshots in this PR.

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: WiNloSt

title: Fix parameter mapping in auto-wiring a new card

How to verify: - New -> Question -> Orders -> Save - New -> Dashboard - Add 2 Text filters -> Connect 1 to User.Source and another Product.Category - Add the same question again and Auto-connect - Each parameter should be mapped to correctly, i.e. to User.Source, Product.Category Before After

title: Fix - Calendar widget jumps when switching months
body:
Fixes #39487

### Description

Fixes layout shift in calendar when using previous/next buttons by adding `mih` prop to the `DatePicker` component.

### How to verify

Stress test: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/10039093680

Dimensions:
- Filter types:
    - single date picker ("Before"/"After"/"On" filters)
    - date range picker ("Between" filter)
    - height should change if other filers are selected ("All time"/"Previous"/"Next"/"Current").
- Usages:
    - time filter
    - filter modal
    - filter pills
    - filter drill
    - notebook editor filter

#### Before

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a5a98a41-f89c-4667-b31e-0a9940f5c253

#### After

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/df1e4fe0-fd3c-47ea-a21f-de483369325e

title: Track query analysis failures in an in-memory map
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45471

### Description

In the future, we will track a record summarizing the result of the last analysis attempt, which can include a running count of failures encountered.

Until then, we want some protection against runaway retries.

This does so with the aid of a bounded in-memory map.

title: Add explicit timeouts to queue implementation
body:
### Description

It turns out that blocking indefinitely is very inconvenient for testing. This avoids needing to run things on background threads, which might be starved in CI.

Unfortunately it decreases how close we get to the heat death of the universe before requiring a process restart. I think most people will upgrade to version 52 by the year 294,295 - [If Man is still alive](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=izQB2-Kmiic)
author: crisptrutski
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: feat(sdk): add CLI to download and start Metabase locally for better onboarding experience
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45781 ### Description Implements a very basic version of the CLI, which download and start Metabase locally for better onboarding experience. ### Demo

First iteration of SDK CLI - Watch Video
### How to run - For local testing: `yarn build-embedding-sdk-cli && node resources/embedding-sdk/dist/cli.js start` - Test in a separate project: `yarn add file:../metabase/resources/embedding-sdk` then `npx @metabase/embedding-sdk-react start`. ### Handled cases - Incompatible or missing React version (set to 18.x for now), will show an error and abort - Port 3366 being occupied - it will pick a random available port between 3000 to 3600 - Docker being unavailable - Container already exists - it would just start that one again, and tell you which port it uses
author: heypoom
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Embedding', ''), ('Embedding/SDK', 'Embedding SDK for React')]

title: Speed up permission migrations by 95% under specific conditions
body:
(Hopefully) resolves https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45701

This PR does two things to optimize the permission migrations in 50 when an instance has a large number of tables, and permissions are set granularly on the tables:
1. It rewrites the `create-queries` migration to avoid a `CROSS JOIN` between groups and tables. This was my first instinct, and it resulted in a decent performance improvement under my test conditions and is incidentally easier to understand IMO, so it's a benefit all around. But the failing migration in #45701 is actually the `view-data` migration, which runs first, so I don't think this resolves the root issue. Leading to...
2. Two new multi-column indexes on the `data_permissions` table: one on `(group_id, db_id, perm_value)` and one on `(group_id, db_id, table_id, perm_value)`. These are both common access patterns both in the migrations and in fetching permissions in the application so I think these are worth keeping around. We also have single-column indexes on all the foreign key columns, but it seems like these multi-column indexes impact performance much more.

3. Edit: I did more load testing with even more total tables and analyzed the query plan and found another place to optimize in the view_data migration. I've split one query into two: one to add `legacy-no-self-service` rows for tables that need it, and another to add `unrestricted` rows for the remaining tables.

**Testing**
Migrations should behave the same as before, so correctness testing is covered by existing tests.

For load testing, I created 100 users randomly distributed into 20 groups, with each user in between 1-10 groups. I also attached 30 copies of the sample H2 database, as well as one 1000 row Postgres database. 

Without these changes: migrating up takes ~**30-35 seconds**
With these changes: migrating up takes ~**2-6 seconds**

(There's a decent amount of variability between attempts‚ÄîI could only reproduce consistently by randomizing permissions between attempts. But these are the rough numbers I observed.)
author: noahmoss

title: Fix several problems with the localization of the Performance feature
body:
Fixes several problems with localization of the Performance feature:
* There were untranslated strings in the strategy form
* Incorrect usage of placeholders was preventing the Schedule picker from using the correct word ordering
* The colon punctuation mark in Asian languages was making the styling of radio buttons incorrect in Japanese and Korean
* The dropdowns were too narrow in Japanese and Korean. The reason is that I assumed that the average character width in all languages is the same as English, but characters are relatively wide in those languages

As part of this work I also looked through some of our most popular languages and corrected a lot of translations of performance-related strings.

Closes #45779

title: Embedding Parameter Values set in Tokens work properly when `nil` or empty list
body:
Fixes: #40292
[Slack convo](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C063Q3F1HPF/p1721388755876919?thread_ts=1719935985.293099&cid=C063Q3F1HPF)

If a locked parameter's value is set to `[]` in the embedding JWT, we want to treat this as 'no value has been set' on that filter, but we should still run the query as normal. Likewise, any linked filters should still properly derive their values from the unfiltered values of the filter to which they are linked.

When you're using a filter in the App, it makes intuitive sense that when you've not selected anything from a filter's
drop down list (or entered any text, etc.), then the filter is effectively not applied.

For token params, we should behave similarly; `[]` should be accepted, and signal that the user intends
for that filter to basically NOT apply. But, `nil` should behave as if the parameter has not been set at all, in which case we should expect the endpoint to return "You must specify a value for [parameter]".

This also means we should not pass the constraint to the linked filters, since it errors, but even if it worked, it
would return 0 results, making it impossible to properly apply the linked filter at all.

So, this change causes empty lists to be treated as nil, AND will remove any parameters with `nil` as a value before
being passed to the query processor, which results in the proper behaviour of not having constraints on the linked
filter, and having the 'parent' filter not filtering anything.

Notice `category 'null'`
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5008ddc4-4dd3-4b4b-bee3-f65a431f8892)

Linked Filter correctly returns all values:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/10b2fd0f-d8c6-4ab3-b96b-3686f9e2eda1)
author: adam-james-v

title: perf: Optimize CSV exporting
body:
CSV exporting implementation has a few easy improvements to make. I managed to cut down the exporting time of @paoliniluis sample dataset (10k*400 booleans and numbers) from 8.5 sec to 5.5 sec (~1/3 reduction). Methods employed:

- More efficient iteration over multiple collections by using Java Iterators. I made custom functions `mapv` and `reduce` that keep the pleasant Clojure API while doing much better on allocations. I've put the new functions into a new `metabase.perf-utils` namespace. This is completely arbitrary; I'll gladly move them to a better place and rename the namespace.
- Improvements to number formatting. This includes caching the constructed formatter for the unique after-0 digit lengths.

In the second commit, I make some changes to `clojure.data.csv` which, let's be honest, was not written with performance in mind. First, `quote?` predicate that checks if a string should be escaped, is very sloppy for a function that is called on every single written value. Second, I modified `write-cell` because it uses `clojure.core/escape` which is quite inefficient too. This part popped up to me because my locale uses `,` as a decimal separator, so all numbers in CSV on my machine have to be escaped. This is not as important in a general case where `.` is a decimal separator.
author: alexander-yakushev
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: Derive MySQLEnum from Text instead of TextLike
body:
Fixes #44807.

This change is in accordance with https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/enum.html describing the ENUM types as a kind of string.  All our string operations seem to work with MySQL ENUM fields.

title: fix(sdk): make png/pdf export work in the sdk
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45732

### Description

html2canvas and jspdf don't work on the sdk because we're using dynamic imports for them in the main app.

I was trying to do some conditional logic with envs to make it load dynamically in the main app, but statically in the sdk, but I realized we just need to import them statically in the sdk to make them work, without the extra complication of the conditional logic.

title: Do not render `ExecutionTime` if there is no `time` to format
body:
### What does this PR accomplish?
Fixes #45730 by preventing the render to happen if `time` is missing for any reason.

We could run into this because of a network error (as explained in the issue). In that case, `result` does not contain the `running_time` that we're passing down to `ExecutionTime` component.

I've adjusted the props interface to reflect this new finding.

### Checklist
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Bulk filter modal incorrectly suggests that you can filter by values in a JSON column
body: Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38111 Previously the type system worked in a way that structured field types (JSON, XML) were considered strings. This made the FE show filter widgets for these types but all queries would fail. As only `is-null` and `not-null` are allowed, this PR makes a change to no longer treat `:type/Structured` as `:type/Text`. How to verify: - Postgres with a json field - Make sure that the UI only allows to use `is-null` and `not-null` (which are called `Is empty` and `Not empty` in the UI).
author: ranquild

title: Asynchronously fix missing, stale, or orphaned Query Analysis
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45464

### Description

This beefs up the old backfill task, so that it will fix stale analysis on start up, and clean up trash. The job also runs continuously now.

It was already upgraded to use back pressure from the analyzer worker.

### Manual testing

1. Check that we fix stale analysis on start-up.
  - Have some cards with more than one query field.
  - Stop the server.
  - Delete some of the query fields, but leaving at least 1 per card.
  - Start the server.
  - Verify that the gaps are filled.
2. Check that we fill in the gaps for running instance.
  - Have some cards with analysis.
  - Delete all analysis for some cards.
  - Wait up to 4 hours (sorry - you're welcome to tweak the config üòâ)
  - Verify that the analysis is present.
 3. Check that we delete orphan records.
  - Have some cards with analysis.
  - Archive some cards.
  - Wait up to 4 hours (ditto)
  - Verity that the analysis is *no longer* present.
author: crisptrutski
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Fix - App crashes when navigating back during model creation
body:
Closes #34514


### Description

There were 2 issues:
1. Navigating between "Query" and "Metadata" tabs in model editor used `history.replace` instead of `history.push`, even though they have different pathnames (`/model/query` & `/model/metadata`)
2. When navigating back to the step before the data source is selected there was an invalid POST `/api/dataset` request being sent (empty query: `{ "query": {}, "type": "query", "parameters": [] }`)

### How to verify

Stress test: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/9974686269

----

1. New > Model > Use the notebook editor > Orders
2. Run the question
3. Go to "Metadata" tab
4. Click the back button in your browser

"Query" tab should be active now

5. Click the back button in your browser
6. Close the entity picker

There should be no error message.
The state should look exactly the same as when you go to New > Model > Use the notebook editor, and close the entity picker modal.
author: kamilmielnik

title: Fix pulse being sent multiple times
body:
In https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/42331 we updated so that every send-pulse trigger will reschedule its trigger with a new priority based on its processing time.
This was meant to prioritize fast pulses to be executed first. 

However, it introduced a bug in that the `reschedule` step will re-trigger itself if `now == the new schedule time`.

So imagine you have a trigger that runs at `06:00:00.000`, and the `reschedule` happens at `06:00:00.03`, then it'll re-trigger itself to run another time. 

Although prioritizing fast pulse is nice, it doesn't make a big difference, so I'll revert that change.

If we still want this, we can create a separate job instead of doing it inline with the send-pulse job itself.

How to reproduce:
1. Setup email
2. Create a question that limit to 1 result (basically create a question that process very fast)
3. Create an alert that is schedule earliest to your time
4. Modify the function `metabase.task.send-pulses/send-pulse!*` to 
```clojure
(defn- send-pulse!*
  [schedule-map pulse-id channel-ids]
  (let [cleared-channel-ids         (clear-pulse-channels-no-recipients! pulse-id)
        to-send-channel-ids         (set/difference channel-ids cleared-channel-ids)
        to-send-enabled-channel-ids (t2/select-pks-set :model/PulseChannel :id [:in to-send-channel-ids] :enabled true)]
   (task/reschedule-trigger! (send-pulse-trigger pulse-id schedule-map channel-ids (send-trigger-timezone) 6))
   (if (seq to-send-enabled-channel-ids)
     (send-pulse! pulse-id to-send-enabled-channel-ids)
     (log/infof "Skip sending pulse %d because all channels have no recipients" pulse-id))))
```
We basically move the `reschedule` step to the top here, this will increase the likelihood of having multiple triggers within a second.
5. wait until the trigger time of the pulse ( sorry :( )

Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45622
author: qnkhuat
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Indicate in-progress exports
body: # Since I'm on vacation please merge the PR once it is approved Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44686 Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41532 ### Description Adds an in-progress indicator when users are exporting questions as CSV, JSON, or XLSX from the query builder or dashboards. We don't show it for PNG exports since they are essentially client-side and there is no meaningful delay. It should be visible in all context: authenticated, public dashboards, embedded dashboards. **Even though this PR contains string changes we are still backporting it to v50** [Slack thread on backporting](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C064QMXEV9N/p1721324616525049) ### How to verify Verify CSV, JSON, or XLSX downloads from query builder, dashboards including public and embedded show the loader. ### Demo ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: remove migration linter to prevent us from using deleteCascade in addColumn
body:
This linter was added in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/27234 to force us to use 2 migrations to add a FK because liquibase didn't respect the `onDeleteCascade: true` setting. Now the bug is fixed upstream and we can stop adding a FK like this


```yaml
- changeSet:
      id: v50.2024-07-02T16:49:29
      author: adam-james
      comment: Add dashboard_id column to user_parameter_value to keep values unique per dashboard
      changes:
        - addColumn:
            columns:
              - column:
                  name: dashboard_id
                  type: int
                  remarks: The ID of the dashboard
            tableName: user_parameter_value

  - changeSet:
      id: v50.2024-07-02T16:55:42
      author: adam-james
      comment: Add fk constraint to user_parameter_value.dashboard_id
      changes:
        - addForeignKeyConstraint:
            baseTableName: user_parameter_value
            baseColumnNames: dashboard_id
            referencedTableName: report_dashboard
            referencedColumnNames: id
            constraintName: fk_user_parameter_value_dashboard_id
            nullable: false
            deleteCascade: true
```

and just use one migration like this

```yaml
  - changeSet:
      id: v51.2024-07-08T10:00:01
      author: qnkhuat
      comment: Create pulse_channel.channel_id
      preConditions:
        - onFail: MARK_RAN
        - not:
            - columnExists:
                tableName: pulse_channel
                columnName: channel_id
      changes:
        - addColumn:
            tableName: pulse_channel
            columns:
              - column:
                  name: channel_id
                  type: integer
                  remarks: The channel ID
                  constraints:
                    nullable: true
                    referencedTableName: channel
                    referencedColumnNames: id
                    foreignKeyName: fk_pulse_channel_channel_id
                    deleteCascade: true
```

This is the SQL generated for such migration
```clojure
metabase.pulse=> (println (:forward (dev.migrate/migration-sql-by-id "v51.2024-07-08T10:00:01" :postgres)))
ALTER TABLE pulse_channel ADD channel_id INTEGER;
ALTER TABLE pulse_channel ADD CONSTRAINT fk_pulse_channel_channel_id FOREIGN KEY (channel_id) REFERENCES channel (id) ON DELETE CASCADE;
COMMENT ON COLUMN pulse_channel.channel_id IS 'The channel ID';
nil
metabase.pulse=> (println (:forward (dev.migrate/migration-sql-by-id "v51.2024-07-08T10:00:01" :mysql)))
ALTER TABLE pulse_channel ADD channel_id INT NULL COMMENT 'The channel ID';
ALTER TABLE pulse_channel ADD CONSTRAINT fk_pulse_channel_channel_id FOREIGN KEY (channel_id) REFERENCES channel (id) ON DELETE CASCADE;
nil
metabase.pulse=> (println (:forward (dev.migrate/migration-sql-by-id "v51.2024-07-08T10:00:01" :h2)))
ALTER TABLE pulse_channel ADD channel_id INT;
ALTER TABLE pulse_channel ADD CONSTRAINT fk_pulse_channel_channel_id FOREIGN KEY (channel_id) REFERENCES channel (id) ON DELETE CASCADE;
COMMENT ON COLUMN pulse_channel.channel_id IS 'The channel ID';
nil
```
author: qnkhuat
labels: [('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Some Email/Attachment Improvements and Fixes
body:
Fixes: #45678

An update that passes formatted column names to the table renderer broke the conditional formatting color lookup.
This PR includes a fix, passing the original column names to the table body render function, so colors will be found
and used. It also adds a test confirming this behaviour.

Fixes: #37491

Even with fixed color lookup, if a row has conditional formatting that depends on the value of a hidden column, that row would not have its formatting applied. Now, the function that creates the color lookup is given all columns, even if they're hidden. This means that in the actual table render, all columns will be available in the color lookup and so rows can be correctly formatted. Note that the color lookup seeing all columns does NOT affect if those columns are rendered; we still correctly hide the hidden columns in rendering.

Fixes: #18789

Adjusting the pulse body structure can move the horizontal scrolling to the card's contents rather than Title +
contents, allowing for better behaviour. It appears that the horizontal scrollbar is automatically displayed when
there is an opportunity to scroll, so that part of the issue should already be covered.

Fixes: #45123

When a dashboard contains a single tab, we don't need to render that tab's title in emails. Likewise, if multiple tabs exist but only 1 contains cards, we also don't need to render the title.
author: adam-james-v
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: [perf] Properly buffer while streaming JSON to API responses
body:
Fixes #34795. 

### Description

Previously, due to over-eager `.flush()` calls in Cheshire, we were
flushing the output stream for every `data.rows` entry. Typically this
resulted in 3 + N TCP packets sent, where N is the number of rows being
returned.

This PR rebuilds how we stream the JSON responses to avoid extra
`.flush()` calls. For the unit test in this PR, that reduced the number
of packets sent over the wire from 37524 to 4.

### How to verify

If you're comfortable using Wireshark or similar tools, send a query for a lot of
rows and find the `/query` call, then follow its TCP stream. You'll see 1 client packet and thousands of
server packets before this PR, and a handful of server packets with it.

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: bshepherdson
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: fix tab actions not working in firefox
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45364

### Description

The root cause of the issue is a bug in React 18: https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/25282. Our issue only surfaced after v50 release since we just upgraded to React 18. What happened was `TabButton` would re-render excessively when clicking on tabs or tab menu items, due to it's use of the `isDragging` value from the `useSortable` hook. These re-renders caused the `onClick` handler in `TabButtonMenu` to be lost, which is why nothing was happening when the user tried to duplicate or delete a tab. For some unknown reason, this bug would only appear in Firefox, not Chrome or Safari.

To resolve the issue, we eliminate the excessive re-renders by no longer using the `useSortable` hook and its `isDragging` value in `TabButton`. This boolean was originally used to truncate the name of a tab to allow it to be dragged to the end of the tab list. Now, instead of truncating the name to make the tab smaller and draggable to the end of the tab list, we instead implement a custom collision detection algorithm to provide to dnd-kit, that will use the edge of the tab to determine collision, and thus allow the user to drag a tab with a long name to either end, without needing to truncate the name using the `isDragging` value. 


### How to verify

Follow repro steps from the issue using Firefox, confirm it no longer happens. Also confirm you can drag a tab with a long name to either end, and dragging tabs to re-order generally still works.

### Demo

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8ae41b56-42e2-40d0-96b5-e3df3d525731

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Sync Snowflake `VARIANT` type as new `:type/SnowflakeVariant`
body:
Snowflake has a `VARIANT` type that is untyped but can be any type of value.

Probably by accident in < 49 we allowed you to use custom expressions that take `type/Text` arguments like `regexextract` (called `regex-match-first` under the hood) against `VARIANT` columns. In 49+ we have better type checking and only let you use `regex-match-first` against `type/Text` columns, so these queries stopped working.

The fix here was to sync `VARIANT` as a new base type called `:type/SnowflakeVariant` that derives from `:type/Text` as well as the other major core base types like `:type/Number` and `:type/Temporal` so you should theoretically be allowed to use with anything in the custom expression editor (whether or not this makes sense is not something we can currently check unfortunately since the column is untyped). 

Fixes #45206

This fix will not take effect until the database is re-synced.

Also I noticed that we have an MLv2 function and schema for a `:regexextract` clause, even tho it doesn't actually exist, so I fixed that while I was at it. 

Fixes #45672
author: camsaul
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: fix(sdk) - fix popover errors on dashboard parameters
body:
Attempts to fix popovers when users try to change the filters on the dashboard parameter popover. There are two major errors that I ran into which were causing things to snag:

```
Error: Unable to find node on an unmounted component.
    at findCurrentFiberUsingSlowPath (react-dom.development.js:4552:1)
    at findCurrentHostFiber (react-dom.development.js:4703:1)
    at findHostInstanceWithWarning (react-dom.development.js:28745:1)
    at Object.findDOMNode (react-dom.development.js:29645:1)
    at WrappedComponent._getElement (ExplicitSize.tsx:81:1)
    at __updateSize (ExplicitSize.tsx:188:1)
    at later (throttle.js:16:1)
```

I found that this one was being caused by the `ExplicitSize` call on the `FieldValuesWidget`, where the `FieldValuesWidget` would unmount before `ExplicitSize` tried to find the height and width of the component.

The solution to this one was to use the mantine `useElementSize` hook within the `FieldValuesWidget` component, and `useThrottle` to ensure we don't get sudden resize events (and an overload of rerenders).


```
Tether Error: Both element and target must be defined
```

This one, I am 99% sure, came from the `PopoverWithTrigger` that we were using the parameters dropdown - some times, there are issues with the usage of `Tether` (for a reason I still can't figure out) that cause the referred `target` to turn to `null` - something to the effect of the target component unmounting causes this error.

The solution here is to get rid of this `PopoverWithTrigger` and replace it with the Mantine popover, which hasn't given us any issues on the SDK so far, so I felt it was a better option than attempt to debug deprecated code.

---

To verify, all tests should still pass. This PR as a whole is more of a refactor rather than any new changes that have been added.
author: oisincoveney
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: perf: Optimize XLSX export by using more efficient iteration
body:
When XLSX export is performed, a considerable amount of time is spent inefficiently iterating over lazy sequences to produce exported cells. This PR ensures that the iterated collections are constructed eagerly, and replaces `doseq` with Java iterators.

I also rewrote `rounds-to-int?` to not use bigdecimals as converting to it involves string parsing and allocations. The behavior for some numbers may change, such as `1.005` now rounds to `1.00`, not to `1.001` (because in double representation `1.005 * 100` is `100.49999...`). I can revert this change if this is important; the performance improvement from this is not critical.
author: alexander-yakushev
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: perf: Work around Apache POI ColumnHelper performance bug
body:
Starting with Apache POI 5.2.3, when a cell is added, its default style is computed from the styles of the whole column. When exporting big datasets, this creates a lot of unnecessary work. Unfortunately, there is no easy way to undo this other than hacking into private fields to replace the ColumnHelper object with our custom proxy.

The problem can be narrowed to this method: https://github.com/apache/poi/blob/0dac5680/poi-ooxml/src/main/java/org/apache/poi/xssf/usermodel/helpers/ColumnHelper.java#L306. The method `getColumn` later seemingly goes over all cells in the column which is completely redundant for the XLSX exporting usecase.

Context:

- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/29839
- https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Perf-Issues-0072ed5300554f3f9ca733d8f6564380
author: alexander-yakushev
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

I am truly surprised there is no way to do something like this - are you not able to use `setStyle` on the underlying column objects to override that inference? I haven't looked at the code to check. This approach still saves us the wasteful iteration over the columns to handle merged cells etc, which I think is creating a lot of that memory pressure though.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 7, 17, 8, 1, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2232696455, 'issue_id': 2411836307, 'author': 'alexander-yakushev', 'body': '> I am truly surprised there is no way to do something like this - are you not able to use setStyle on the underlying column objects to override that inference? title: Infer id numeric columns as non metrics
body:
[Slack thread](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C064QMXEV9N/p1718761931598589)

### Description

This PR slightly tweaks the logic of detecting which columns are metric columns to exclude numeric ID-like columns as metrics. It will improve column auto selection on cartesian charts in cases when there are only numeric columns but some are IDs.

### How to verify

```sql
select distinct invoices.ACCOUNT_ID, count(*)
from invoices
group by invoices.ACCOUNT_ID
```

1. New -> SQL query -> use the query above
2. Run the query and switch the visualization type to `Bar`
3. It should autoselect account_id as dimension and count(*) as metric 

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: fix(sdk): fix downloads not working on sdk
body:
### Description

Dashcard result downloads are currently broken on shoppy.

```
https://shoppy.hosted.staging.metabase.com/api/embed/dashboard/17/dashcard/128/card/137/xlsx?format_rows=false 400 (Bad Request)
```

The reason is that in this line https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/45657/files#diff-092f7717c9da015485d46abf21da8668d6e76b8f8664cfc937c3da4cd249d0f5L217

we're passing down an id on the `token` field, because `isEmbed` is true, and then in `getDatasetParams` we think that because we have a token we should be downloading from the embed endpoints:
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/ab0ddae4fcb37cfe9dfd9f4d3ed3291f2d576150/frontend/src/metabase/query_builder/actions/downloading.ts#L79-L80

body:
partly addresses #45647

This small PR introduces a simpler method of parsing cron expressions, in a utility that the `Schedule` component uses. This method works on old versions of Safari. Previously we were using a method (namely, the "lookbehind" method) that does not work in a relatively recent version of Safari (v16.3, released 17 months ago) (according to [caniuse.com](https://caniuse.com/js-regexp-lookbehind)). The unit tests (some of which are new in this PR) validate that this method yields the same results as the previous one.

(Footnote: Here's a little more context. The `Schedule` component lets people specify how frequently they want a cache to be invalidated, such as hourly. This schedule is stored as a cron expression. We need to parse a certain component of the cron expression, the weekday, which might look like `6#1` or `1L`, and we were using a lookbehind regex to parse this.)
author: rafpaf
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: poc of using loki to test png/pdf exports
body: # Description This PR adds visual testing to the PNG exports for question on public links and static embeds. The way it works is that we make the app code replace the contents of the story with the generated image and we then screenshot it. For the pdf, we run into an issue where the chrome installed in the docker image doesn't have the plugins needed to display the pdf, so we decided to test the png of that too, which should still cover visual regressions. ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8d6c81ef-da00-463b-bb39-b864a2184378) I created a [task for the pdfs](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/47211) It kinda breaks storybook when navigating out of the stories that use this approach: because of this line that we have to use to show only the image we want to screenshot ```ts window.document.querySelector("#root")?.replaceChildren(imgElement); ```
author: npretto

title: fix(webapp/sidenav): Fix bookmark reordering
body:
On master, when you drag bookmarks to reorder them, the correct order is not saved, and bookmarks appear to be shuffled almost randomly if you reorder them more than once.

On this branch, bookmarks are reordered correctly and optimistically.

![Kapture 2024-07-19 at 19 59 39](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ce6c74d3-8ed9-482c-bc32-90a66d3945c4)

Closes #45635

Known problem: There is some flickering, as the GIF above shows

[x] e2e tests added

Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45565

### Description

- Add static question visual tests
- Add static dashboard transparent theme visual tests
- Add `background` assertion in analytics tests

### How to verify

All tests passes

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Fix - `useIsTruncated` gives incorrect results
body:
Fixes #45358

Previous attempt: #45347

### Description

The current [`getIsTruncated`](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/54c1e07/frontend/src/metabase/hooks/use-is-truncated.ts#L41-L46) implementation uses `clientHeight`/`clientWidth`/`scrollHeight`/`scrollWidth`:
- these properties are integers and so they lose precision - it means they don't account for cases where 0px < difference < 1px (where "difference" means the difference between ellipsis being applied and not)
- setting `width` on an element may prevent it from resizing when ellipsis is applied, so comparing the aforementioned properties won't give any useful information

Credits to @ranquild for [the idea](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C0645JP1W81/p1721052584800439?thread_ts=1721031248.290819&cid=C0645JP1W81) :1st_place_medal: 

### How to verify

CI is green.

1. New question > Orders
2. Add breakout "Created At" - "Month of year"
3. Click to edit breakout
4. Hover over truncated "by month of year"

There should be a tooltip.

title: Refactor perms middleware to enforce view-data at the table-level
body:
Pasting my summary from Slack:
> QP permissions middleware looks for View data perms for the full DB by default. This is satisfied when all tables are Sandboxed or Can view. But when any tables are No self-service (deprecated), this condition isn't satisfied.
>
> When running the query, there's an additional mechanism in the sandboxing middleware to add extra perms that are required by the sandboxes via a special key. That's why there isn't an error when running the query. But when saving the card, we run the permission-checking middleware but don't do the full query pre-processing so this mechanism doesn't take effect, and it leads to an error.

TL;DR: This PR refactors the permission-checking middleware so that we enforce `view-data` perms at the table-level to run a query, rather than always enforcing `view-data` perms for the entire DB. This avoids `No self-service (deprecated)` in _other_ tables from impacting the permissions of a query that doesn't touch those tables. 

Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45595
author: noahmoss
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: feat(sdk): theme option to customize popover's z-index
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45587

### Description

The popover for click actions are being shown behind the user‚Äôs modal. This only happens when the user puts an interactive question in a modal component of their choice, and the modal has a higher z-index than the Tippy popover.

PS. This is only an issue with the legacy Tippy popover, as Mantine-based Popovers already renders to `EMBEDDING_SDK_ROOT_ELEMENT_ID` and thus does not suffer from a z-index problem. With that said, this PR applies it to Mantine-based popover as well for consistency. The z-index value should apply to all popovers.

This PR exposes a theme option to customize the popover's z-index for all popovers.

![Arc 2567-07-16 05 20 16](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/586965f3-d65b-41b4-8135-94eb8422dc2c)

### How to verify

- Go to https://github.com/metabase/shoppy/pull/54
- Click action popovers should render over the portal

### Demo

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25df6aa6-e42f-4048-a5ee-faa448b4e64f)

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Remove unnecessary explicit size from charts legend layout
body:
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45454

### Description

An attempt to fix https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45454
I did not manage to reproduce the original problem in any browser, however, it looks like the problem is related to `ExplicitSize` hoc which is triggered in a loop. This PR removes unnecessary `ExplicitSize` usage from `LegendLayout` which wraps two viz implementations: cartesian charts built with echarts and the Row chart built with visx.

### How to verify

First of all, try to reproduce the original issue.
Then ensure cartesian charts built with echarts (line/area/bar/combo/waterfall/scatter) and the Row chart work correctly. This includes the way they resize when they have horizontal or vertical legends.

### Demo

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22453799-c0d8-4041-af7c-7afa765e8154

### Checklist

- [n/a] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Fix #37893: Do not offer alerts for models
body:
Deals with the frontend portion of #37893. The backend will be implemented separately.

### Description

This PR removes the option to set alerts on models, at least on the FE.

> [!Important]
> It doesn't handle the scenarios in which some instances might already have alerts set on models, as I believe that wasn't the scope of this issue.
>
> It also doesn't prevent users from using API to set alerts on models. That should be handled separately on the backend.

### How to verify
1. Open any saved model or create one
2. You shouldn't be able to see the bell icon in the footer, i.e. you shouldn't be able to set up an alert for this model in the UI

### Demo
![Screenshot 2024-07-15 at 23 52 15](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/af9a11a6-a8e5-4334-b27c-5a78eb3b9e13)

### Checklist
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

### Stress-test

title: feat(sdk): add useMetabaseAuthStatus hook to get current authentication status
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45585

### Description

Exposes a React hook to check if we've successfully authenticated via the MetabaseProvider, so we can support rendering the component conditionally. When the user is not logged in, we see the default error messages added with withPublicComponentWrapper. We want to provide the ability to skip rendering the component when the `MetabaseProvider` authentication fails for any reason.

### How to verify

- Go to the demo app
- Calls the `useMetabaseAuthStatus` hook
- The authentication status (`auth.status`) should change accordingly.
author: heypoom

title: Preprocess queries before data perms check
body:
When we run queries, we preprocess them, during which the sandboxing middleware adds information that we use when checking permissions later on in query processing.

When we checked data permissions before saving a card, we were checking permissions on the raw query, without preprocessing. Without the data provided by the sandboxing middleware, the permission check sometimes failed (depending on the permissions for other tables in the DB).

Fixes #45595
author: johnswanson
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 2229380875, 'issue_id': 2409563709, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 7, 15, 20, 40, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2231430163, 'issue_id': 2409563709, 'author': 'johnswanson', 'body': '> You'd think that if you can't preprocess a query you can't run it, which is what we're trying to check here anyway. So maybe we should just let the error bubble up? But maybe that feels a little risky. I think this is right, but it seems like we're doing some specific checks to get better error messages than the QP can provide. For example, if you try to create a card with a query like this: ``` {:database bird-counts-db-id :type :native :native {:query "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM PRODUCTS WHERE {{FILTER}}" :template-tags {"FILTER" {:id "_FILTER_" :name "FILTER" :display-name "Filter" :type :dimension :dimension [:field (mt/id :venues :name) nil] :widget-type :string/= :default nil}}}} ``` We give back `Invalid Field Filter: Field {0} belongs to Database {1}, but the query is against Database {2}`, where QP will give us: ``` Error preprocessing query in clojure.lang.AFunction$1@494c947d: Error building query parameter map: Error determining value for parameter \"FILTER\": Can't find field with ID: 50 ```', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 7, 16, 17, 14, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

title: Fix string filters with multiple values in dashboards
body: Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43990 As mentioned in the issue, in legacy MBQL there is a different syntax when there are multiple values AND operator options. That's why the issue exists only with `contains`, `does-not-contain`, `starts-with`, `ends-with` operators and multiple values. How to verify: - New -> Question -> Products - Add this question to a dashboard - Add a filter Text -> **Contains** - Connect this filter to Vendor - Add a filter with multiple values - Make sure that title drill (i.e. click on the card title) works Before: Now: - CI is green

title: fix(sdk): sync fetch request token function with store
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45583

### Description

The `config.fetchRequestToken` function in the embedding sdk did not synchronize to the Redux context, therefore it always used the function captured from the first render. This PR ensures that the function gets updated.

### How to verify

- Check out the `test-sync-fetch-refresh-token` branch in Shoppy
- Click on the red button a couple of times to increment the counter
- Change the site via the site switcher
- The network request should include a "X-Integer" header with the latest count.

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: heypoom

title: Add fallback filter widgets for uncommon (or unknown by Metabase) data types
body: Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45252 Previously we showed filter widgets only for known supported types (numbers, strings, etc). But we have other types in our type system that didn't have filter widgets at all. As we can always use `IS NULL` and `IS NOT NULL` filters, let's expose them in the UI. For the filter picker (notebook, ...) I used the same layout as for boolean filters. For the filter modal, I did something similar to boolean filters as well. The checkboxes were used because otherwise there would be no way of removing this filter in the filter modal. How to verify: - Follow the steps from the issue and create a PG table with an array field. - Add this database to Metabase and try to add a filter for `Identifiers`. Also did some cleanup: - Simplified `operators.cljc` - Renamed `isDate` to `isTemporal` as in clojure because `isTemporal` is actually true for `Time`, so the name was incorrect - Checked for allowed operators before using something as the default operator
author: ranquild
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Fix - More than 10 Series (using Add Series Dashboard Feature) cause Filter UI to be inaccessible
body:
Fixes #43219

### Description

The original issue only mentions the problem with horizontal overflow, however vertical had the problem as well. This PR fixes both.

### How to verify

Stress test: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/9940076735

Repro:
1. Create 1+10 line bar questions
2. Create a dashboard
4. Add first question to it
5. Change dashcard size to minimum (4x3)
6. Add series to this dashcard - every other question from step 1
7. Add dashboard parameter (e.g. text filter)
8. Click on the parameter to start editing mapping
9. Try to map the parameter to the last series

Previously: card mapping is cut off (due to `overflow: hidden`)
Now: dashcard is scrollable


### Demo

Before: [image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cc21630b-d5fb-4e7d-a929-3879468c954e)

After: [image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a7ecdfd5-b978-4d35-b2d6-c8a317000013)
author: kamilmielnik

title: Implement SQL Analysis worker
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45462
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45463

### Description

With this change, all query analysis happens off the main thread, and it is rate limited in order to run less than 20% of the time averaged out over time.

title: [Notification] Render alert for http channel
body:
Milestone 2.2 of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43822

The goal is to create an end-to-end flow of alerts to an HTTP channel using APIs. See this [demo](https://www.loom.com/share/c50c73eddfff49ec8836bb95e10c3429?sid=14915312-0de3-4552-b4d6-49ddca489e31)

As part of this PR, we added a new column, `pulse_channel.channel_id`; this column is currently only used to store the HTTP channel IDs. Updating alert apis to enable an HTTP channel for an alert will be done as part of milestone 2.3.

Long term goal is that we'll remove the `pulse_channel` table completely and migrate to a [new architecture](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Notification-high-level-design-9620a4a69db0494f806a146cc9174964?pvs=4), but `pulse_channel.channel_id` is needed for short-term goal of having multiple HTTP channel connections per instance.
author: qnkhuat
labels: [('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Add more feature flags for query analysis
body:
### Description

This complements the flag used to opt out of SQL analysis in existing v50 versions, with one for MBQL. It also adds a kill switch for all analysis.

Given the overarching setting, it makes more sense to name the settings in the negative, as they are not the final authority on whether the relevant queries are analyzed, but they can disable them definitively.

In order for more consistently structured and grouped naming, and flipping to the negative, we deprecate the existing flag.
author: crisptrutski
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Feature/frontend
body:
> [!IMPORTANT]
> For those employed by Metabase: if you are merging into master, please add either a `backport` or a `no-backport` label to this PR. You will not be able to merge until you do this step. Refer to the section [Do I need to backport this PR?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#89f80d6f17714a0198aeb66c0efd1b71) in the Metabase Branching Strategy document for more details. If you're not employed by Metabase, this section does not apply to you, and the label will be taken care of by your reviewer.

> **Warning**
>
> If that is your first contribution to Metabase, please sign the [Contributor License Agreement](https://docs.google.com/a/metabase.com/forms/d/1oV38o7b9ONFSwuzwmERRMi9SYrhYeOrkbmNaq9pOJ_E/viewform) (unless it's a tiny documentation change). Also, if you're attempting to fix a translation issue, please submit your changes to our [POEditor project](https://poeditor.com/join/project/ynjQmwSsGh) instead of opening a PR.

Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/[issue_number]

### Description

Describe the overall approach and the problem being solved.

### How to verify

Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.

1. New question -> Sample Dataset -> ...
2. ...

### Demo

_Upload a demo video or before/after screenshots if sensible or remove the section_

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: meghanasharathd

title: E2E repro for "Admins can't create queries on Metabase Analytics models"
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43088

The issue was fixed when we moved to `query_metadata` endpoints for each entity.

How to verify:
- Run EE
- Open "Metabase analytics" collection, select some model
- Make sure that you can turn it into an adhoc question

title: Optimize autocomplete filters in FilterModal
body: Related to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43426 Fixes some of the symptoms of the issue. Now, for "search box" and "list of all values" inputs, we do not update the MBQL lib query on each character. The optimization was already in place, but just wasn't used for these components. How to verify: - New -> Question -> Orders - Join -> Orders (self join) on ID = ID - Visualize - Filter - Select the second "User" group (implicit join for the self joined table) - `User.Email` -> change operator to IS, enter something and select the value - Apply filters - Only 1 filter should be added Please note that this PR only fixes the issue when during editing the input doesn't loose the focus. It doesn't fix the issue with MBQL lib not finding the correct filter for this column, forcing us to create a new filter each time. So the issue above won't be closed by this PR.
author: ranquild
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]
